body:
Thanks @harupy . I am basically using the logistic regression example from mlflow/examples

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29711150/95570488-a7ce7c00-0a2f-11eb-80e0-0c8442d2742c.png)
@AVSuni Can you paste the code as a text?

```python
import numpy as np
import mlflow
import mlflow.sklearn
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

penalty = 'l2'
X = np.array([-4,2 -1, 0, 1, 2, 1]).reshape(-1, 1)
np.savetxt("foo.csv", X, delimiter=",")
y = np.array([0, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0])
lr = LogisticRegression(penalty = penalty)
lr.fit(X, y)
score = lr.score(X, y)
print("Score: %s" % score)
mlflow.log_metric("score", score)
mlflow.log_param("penalty", penalty)
mlflow.sklearn.log_model(lr, "model")
mlflow.log_artifact("./foo.csv", "data")
print("Model saved in run %s" % mlflow.active_run().info.experiment_id)
```
I wasn't anble to reproduce the issue in my environment.
Does the same thing occur when you run the code as a script, not in the notebook?
Thanks. That's good to know. Yes, the same thing happens when running as script
Can you remove the `mlruns` folder and try running the code again?
How did you lauch the MLflow UI?

I have used the following:

`mlflow server --backend-store-uri file:///host_drive/mlruns --default-artifact-root file:///host_drive/mlruns --host 0.0.0.0`
Can you try `mlflow ui` (without any option)?
`mlflow ui` without options does not give me any of my runs, so even worse than the starting point :)
Did you run the code in https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/3505#issuecomment-706095780 without `create_experiment` or `set_experiment`?
Including/excluding `create_experiment` or `set_experiment` does not make any difference.
It's strange. The code should create an `mlruns` directory in the current directory and `mlflow ui` should load the runs stored in it.

Found the cuplrit! I had the training model running in one container and MLflow server in another container. Clearly metrics and params don't mind that the file path looks different inside the two containers, but artifacts won't show correctly unless the paths are identical inside the containers even when everything is saved in the same location on the host. As you can see, the two paths inside the containers [ #3505 (comment)](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/3505#issue-718009202) and #3505 [(comment)](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/3505#issuecomment-706111579) were not identical, changing the latter path inside the MLserver container to match former path fixed the problem. Thanks so much for your persistence and sorry I didn't give all the details in the beginning!
